definition: to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)

sentences.english: Automated assessment of the subjective test is one of key techniques in automated assessment system.
sentences.chinese: 主觀題閱卷技術是計算機自動閱卷中的關鍵技術。

sentences.english: Automated assessment of the subjective test is one of key techniques in automated assessment system.
sentences.chinese: 主觀題閱卷技術是計算機自動閱卷中的關鍵技術。

sentences.english: In Foreign Languages Department, a checking machine is used to correct the students' test papers.
sentences.chinese: 外語教研部用閱卷機給學生批卷。

sentences.english: No student is allowed in staff room during marking period unless supervised by a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 考試閱卷期間，沒有老師在場，學生不得進入辦公室。

sentences.english: Our tearchersare going through our papers in their office.
sentences.chinese: 我們的老師正在辦公室閱卷。

sentences.english: Finally the design of the main form of the reviewing terminal is described.
sentences.chinese: 最後描述了閱卷終端主窗體的設計。

sentences.english: In support of these theories, the article presents a subjective question marking system based on .
sentences.chinese: 主觀題閱卷系統是一個值得研究的問題。

definition: to transfer (from production to other duties)/to take leave (for study or other job)/to dispose of property/to transfer assets (to avoid liability)
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
